title: Kikujiro
creator_credit: Takeshi Kitano, Takio Yoshida, Masayuki Mori, Nippon Herald Films, Bandai Visual Company and Office Kitano
brief_description: Kikujiro, a lazy small time gangster, agrees to take a lonely boy who lives with his grandmother on a road trip during the summer holidays. The two set off to find the boy’s mother who he has never met. Over the course of the return journey the pair meet up with a range of eccentric characters who engage in a series of absurd games and exchanges. While Kitano’s deadpan comic character with a tendency to extreme and sudden violence is familiar from his earlier work, ‘Kikujiro’ marks a departure from the milieu of the criminal underworld to focus on the unlikely bond that gradually develops between the man and boy. The film evokes Chaplin’s ‘The Kid’, both in Kitano’s trademark use of visual gags and in its sentimental bittersweet tone. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Takeshi Kitano, Yusuke Sekiguchi and Kayoko Kishimoto.
